Choices for Hospital.country

class wp4.locations.models.Hospital(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple helper class to hold information related to the various project and non-project locations. Currently referenced from Donor, OrganAllocation, RetrievalTeam, Person

This data is so generic and widely used that there should be no restrictions on geography, and everyone should be able to view it.

Parameters

  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”

  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - Locked by the admin team. This can only be reversed by the System Administrator

  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – “live”

  • name (django.db.models.CharField) – “Hospital Name”

  • country (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Country”

  • is_active (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Active” - Not presently used/implemented. For legacy data when a location closes for use

  • is_project_site (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Project site”

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

organallocation_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

person_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

retrievalteam_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
